instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted
threads.message:
Hello, I need help with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. it has shorted to ground voltage: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>.

How to solve short, do I need solder one by one all caps in that circuit? (they all looks intact)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shorted
threads.message: Inject voltage on the rail and see what heats up. Slowly go up in voltage and monitor current. At 2-3 amps something should get warm. Don't go over 12V of course!
